messages.subject: Young children
messages.msgSnippet: -=-Hi. I have a 20 month girl. Besides reading to her and playing are there any skills i can start nurturing in her? What do you suggest we could be doing at
messages.messageBody:
-=-Hi. I have a 20 month girl. Besides reading to her and playing are
there any skills i can start nurturing in her? What do you suggest we
could be doing at this age? (my main language is Spanish, hope yo get
what i mean).-=-


This question should have a different topic (though I know it might
have had some responses on the other one; that's fine).

The notes from today's chat on young children will be here:
http://sandradodd.com/youngchildren

With a 20 month old, I think carry her as much as she wants to be
carried, let her walk as much as she wants to and not a step further.
I hate to see people holding a kid who wants down, or telling a baby
"you can walk."

Find lots of things she can touch and pick up and hold. There will be
lots of suggestions at the link above pretty soon, too.



Sandra
